greetings_and_pleasantries.greeting_reply_template: {actual_greeting_cased}, {user_mention}! How can I assist you today? May the Force be with your calls!

greetings_and_pleasantries.reply_text: You're welcome! Happy to help, I am. üôÇ
You too! Have a wonderful day! üòä

general_faqs.answer: Wrap up is the time from the end of the call until the call is coded. It's the period where you select the correct disposition for the call. Aim to disposition a call within 10-15 seconds. And remember, do not sit in WRAP UP for too long; if you aren't getting calls within one minute, you might be stuck and should refresh your screen.

If you know that we are busy and you aren't getting any phone calls within one minute while in wrap up, it means you are probably stuck. If this happens you need to refresh your screen. This is not the refresh you're looking for if it persists, contact a supervisor.
Make sure you keep your discord notifications open and check the main chat for the most recent update from Corey. May the force be with you!

As a 1099 contractor at LTS, you are free to break as often as you‚Äôd like. Be sure to alert your shift supervisor to be kept in the queue, securing your spot in that project. This way, the Force will still be with your place in line!
On a voter ID project, once you've confirmed the voter's name, it's a considered a complete.

keywords: what is a complete voter id
general_faqs.answer: For a voter ID project, a 'complete' means the voter's name has been confirmed. Once the voter's name is confirmed, you may code it complete.

keywords: they say it's a wrong number
general_faqs.answer: Code as 'Wrong Number'. For GOTV calls without voicemails, even a Wrong Number is coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

For most projects, code as 'Answering Machine' as soon as possible. If we are NOT handling projects where we are leaving messages on answering machines, you MUST disconnect the call immediately. Do not sit on the line and let the answering machine play. This can be seen as call avoidance. For GOTV calls: if no voicemails, code AM as 'COMPLETE LIVE'. If leaving voicemails, it's 'COMPLETE LEFT MESSAGE'.
If there is no response Code as 'No Answer'. For GOTV calls without voicemails, even a No Answer is coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

keywords: take me off your list general
general_faqs.answer: Code as 'Not Interested' (or 'Not in') if the voter indicates they don't want to participate or be contacted further, but *does not* specifically ask to be put on the 'do not call list'. Be polite and thank them for their time. For GOTV calls without voicemails, even 'Not Interested' is coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

keywords: add to do not call list
general_faqs.answer: The only time a call is coded ‚ÄúDo Not Call‚Äù or DNC, is when the voter specifically asks to be put on the do not call list. Otherwise, any other request to not be contacted is coded as NOT INTERESTED
If the person you are trying to reach is reported Deceased, Code as 'Deceased'. For GOTV calls without voicemails, even Deceased is coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

You will be directed by the Shift Manager if you are put into a Project where we are leaving messages. Great Question! If not leaving messages, and you get an answering machine, disconnect immediately. Do not let the answering machine play.
I keep track daily but Corey will also give you your totals at the halfway point and at the end of the pay period if you ask.
CPH stands for ‚ÄúCompletes Per Hour‚Äù. It refers to how many completed surveys or patches you complete within an hour of dialing.

PATCH CAMPAIGN: Patch work is transferring callers to their Representatives, Congressmen, Assemblymen, Governors, etc. This is important work and requires high professionalism and accuracy.

PROCEDURE: As a rule, patches are always VOTER ASSUMPTIVE, unless otherwise instructed. Patches are not required to be read verbatim; you may cut the script for efficiency. After the voter agrees to the patch, select the YES box and click next, then read the verbiage for the voter to repeat. Select NEXT again. When you hear the phone ring, select COMPLETE PATCH while thanking the voter. If the line is busy, select UNSUCCESSFUL PATCH. It is not okay to sit on the line and listen to the patched conversation.

CODING: Calls are usually coded as COMPLETE PATCH or UNSUCCESSFUL PATCH. Dispositions can vary based on campaign specifics (Voter specific, Voter Assumptive, Non-Voter).

keywords: when is it a full complete
general_faqs.answer: A FULL COMPLETE is defined as having an answer to every single question in the survey.

keywords: when is it a partial complete
general_faqs.answer: A PARTIAL COMPLETE is defined as having an answer to at least one question, but not all the questions. This includes confirming the name of the voter. If a voter refuses to give their YOB, the survey also ends as a PARTIAL COMPLETE. If you confirm the name of the voter but do not complete the survey, it is coded PARTIAL COMPLETE.

When you ask the YOB (Year of Birth) ALWAYS repeat it back to ensure you have it correct (e.g., 'You said 1964, is that correct?'). Failure to repeat the YOB is grounds for disciplinary action. If a voter will not give you their YOB, you must mark it as REFUSED in the survey, and the survey will end as a PARTIAL COMPLETE.
You may NOT give voters contacted during the call ANY personal information, including but not limited to, your phone number, social media, location, or address. This is a strict rule, young Padawan.

keywords: city state address phone number company
general_faqs.answer: You may NOT give out our company's name, name of the city/state, address, or direct phone number. If someone asks you from where you are calling, your response should be, ‚ÄúI apologize, but we are not allowed to provide that information for security reasons.‚Äù

You may ONLY say that you are calling on behalf of the campaign as indicated in the script. If the person demands more information than what's in the script, you must contact a supervisor to handle the call.
You are NOT to give your own opinions on matters being discussed in the project. Your job is to ALWAYS remain unbiased. Like a Jedi, your feelings you must control.

You must accurately code (terminated/disposition) every single call with the appropriate status. Coding is the most important part of the job and your highest responsibility. Failure to do so will result in disciplinary action and if continued, termination. The fate of the galaxy... err, campaign... depends on it!
ALWAYS be professional and end every call with ‚ÄúThank you for your time‚Äù.

keywords: speak only to voter on file
general_faqs.answer: VOTER SPECIFIC calls require you to speak ONLY with the VOF (Voter on File) listed in the script. (ABSOLUTELY NO EXCEPTIONS). As a rule, surveys are always VOTER SPECIFIC, unless otherwise instructed. You MUST confirm that you are speaking to the right person to continue the survey, and they MUST confirm they are that person.

VOTER ASSUMPTIVE calls mean you will ‚Äúassume‚Äù your voter answered the phone. Instead of asking if the voter is there, you will say ‚ÄúHello (voter's name)‚Äù and continue without pause. If the respondent interrupts to say that they are not that voter, you will reply with, ‚Äúthat's alright, I can speak with you as well‚Äù and continue the call without pause. Patches are usually Voter Assumptive.
NON-VOTER calls will not ask for a name. You will speak with whomever answers the phone.

For GOTV (Get Out To Vote) calls, there are generally two disposition approaches:
1. WITHOUT VOICEMAILS: Use 'COMPLETE LIVE' on EVERY CALL, regardless of outcome (answering machine, fax, wrong number, DNC list).
2. WITH VOICEMAILS: Use 'COMPLETE LIVE' on every call EXCEPT when leaving a voicemail (then use 'COMPLETE LEFT MESSAGE'). If you get a fax machine, wrong number, or DNC request, you still code these as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

NEVER ASK GENDER. You will assume the gender based on the voter's name. EXCEPTION: When the gender includes more than MALE or FEMALE, such as NON-BINARY (follow specific campaign instructions for these scenarios if provided).

If you have questions about correct protocol or coding, PLEASE DO NOT HESITATE TO ASK YOUR SUPERVISOR. That is what they're here for, to assist you in reaching your full potential at ‚ÄúLTS‚Äù. If you work from home, message your supervisor on Discord. A Jedi seeks guidance from the Council, an agent seeks guidance from their supervisor!
Surveys are always to be read 100% VERBATIM. There is NO exception to this rule. If it is a survey, you may not ADD or REMOVE a single word from the script.

Be kind and courteous, upbeat and enthusiastic on every interaction. You represent the clients and their representatives. Treat each voter with respect and courtesy. Watch your tone, pace, and quality of voice.
Never be combative with the voter. If the voter becomes upset or disruptive, kindly back out of the call ‚Äì say, ‚ÄúI do apologize and thank you for your time.‚Äù
Every call is recorded and can be monitored for quality assurance purposes. So, always be mindful of your tone, pace, and how you speak to voters.

Once you hear the ‚ÄúBEEP‚Äù in your ear, which indicates that someone is on the line, go right into your introduction. You don't need to continuously say, ‚ÄúHello, hello, hello.‚Äù It sounds unprofessional and can be seen as rude.

If there is no one on the line after giving your introduction, simply say, ‚ÄúThank you for your time.‚Äù We do this because the call is still recorded and there might be someone there even though you can't hear them.

Do not sit on an open line. If you receive a dead air call, thank them for their time, quickly disposition, and move on to the next call. It is highly unacceptable for you to sit for 4 minutes on an open line as this is call avoidance and you will be asked to sign off for the day.

keywords: what to say if voter hesitant
general_faqs.answer:
Here are some common rebuttals you can use:
- ‚ÄúI understand, but this will only take a short moment of your time and your opinion would really make a difference!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúI understand, but your opinion really matters!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúYour voice and opinion are very important; every voice does matter!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúIt's really important for them to hear your voice!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúIt would just take a moment for your voice to be heard!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúYour voice matters!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúWe need your voice, so they know your stand!‚Äù
Use these wisely, you must.

call_codes.Wrong Number: Code as 'Wrong Number'. (For GOTV no-VM, code 'COMPLETE LIVE').
call_codes.Answering Machine: Code as 'Answering Machine'. (For GOTV no-VM, code 'COMPLETE LIVE'; for GOTV with-VM, code 'COMPLETE LEFT MESSAGE' if leaving message). Disconnect immediately if not leaving messages on a non-GOTV project.
call_codes.No Answer: If there is no response Code as 'No Answer'. (For GOTV no-VM, code 'COMPLETE LIVE').
call_codes.Not Interested: Code as 'Not in'. Be polite and thank them for their time. This is used for general requests to not be contacted if the voter does NOT specifically ask for the 'do not call list'. (For GOTV no-VM, code 'COMPLETE LIVE').
call_codes.Do Not Call: Code as 'Do Not Call' ONLY when the voter *specifically asks* to be put on the 'do not call list'. Otherwise, any other request to not be contacted is coded as 'NOT INTERESTED'. No rebuttal needed. (For GOTV no-VM, code 'COMPLETE LIVE').
call_codes.Deceased: If the person you are trying to reach is reported Deceased, Code as 'Deceased'. (For GOTV no-VM, code 'COMPLETE LIVE').
call_codes.COMPLETE LIVE: Used for GOTV calls (typically without voicemail option) for all outcomes including AM, fax, wrong #, DNC, or successful contact not leaving a message. Also used for successful GOTV contacts when leaving voicemails is an option but one wasn't left for that specific call.
call_codes.COMPLETE LEFT MESSAGE: Used for GOTV calls when a voicemail has been successfully left.
call_codes.COMPLETE PATCH: Used when a caller has been successfully transferred (patched) to their representative/target.
call_codes.NOT AVAILABLE: Used in surveys if you do NOT speak to the target voter.
call_codes.UNSUCCESSFUL PATCH: Used if the line is busy or the transfer (patch) otherwise fails.

fallback_message: I'm sorry, I couldn't find an answer for that specific query.
